page.title: 20JODRELL BANK-A CHILD'S VIEW
page.content: From the upstairs window casually glancing, Through the trees I see, Jodrell Bank. Playing tennis in the evening, Between the houses I see, Jodrell Bank Walking through the village, I turn the corner Across the fields I see, Jodrell Bank. You can never get away from it. Even in the dark you see its shady outline, Like a huge saucer it can be seen {miles}away! Out in the country you turn a corner, What can you see? {JODRELL BANK!!!} by Catherine Simmons Age 10 {**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=** {| }This block was compiled by the {| {* } third year junior class of {* {* }Goostrey school, and edited by {* {| }their teacher, Mrs Linda Messham {| {**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**=**
